request_pathways.name: Authorization for Release of Protected or Privileged Health Information
Fax completed form to Release of Information (617-726-3661)
Mail completed form to Release of Information, 121 Inner Belt Road, Room 240, Somerville, MA 02143-4453

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients download a general-purpose MGB authorization form, select 'Personal' as purpose, and check a box to receive records at their own address; form is submitted via fax or mail.

red_flags: Form requires patients to 'MUST specify dates' for each record type, which may exceed HIPAA requirements for patient access requests
Records from outside providers held by MGB are excluded unless patient specifically requests them, placing a knowledge burden on the patient
bright_spots: 78 fillable/interactive form fields enabling genuine on-screen completion
Four delivery methods including Patient Gateway (portal) and Secure Email
Trilingual availability: English, Spanish, and Portuguese
Implicit fee exemption for patient access — copying fees asterisked only for Insurance, Legal, and Other purposes, not Personal or Medical Care

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation or a simple search — a single web search returned the direct PDF URL, and the NWH website provides a clear navigable path, though with one extra redirect through the MGB parent system page.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital with one gap — the form has 78 fillable fields enabling full on-screen completion, but submission requires fax or mail (no online form submission), though records can be delivered electronically.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor clarity issues — five clearly lettered sections (A-E) with logical flow and clean layout, but Section D contains dense regulatory language and the 'MUST specify dates' instruction adds complexity.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — the form is a generic third-party authorization that accommodates patient self-access via 'Personal' purpose checkbox and self-mailing option, but doesn't distinguish patient access rights or reference Right of Access.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing materially impeding — no notarization required, implicit fee exemption for patient access, standard expiration and revocation provisions, though the 'MUST specify dates' requirement and outside records carve-out go slightly beyond what HIPAA requires.

overall.summary: Newton-Wellesley Hospital provides a technically well-executed, fillable authorization form through its MGB parent system that is easy to find and digitally usable, but lacks a dedicated patient self-access pathway, funneling all requestors through a generic third-party release form.
